rationale: Semaglutide continuation, dose, schedule, and refrigeration instructions are entirely missing from the note.
No mention of stopping glyburide or packing it away.
Captures start the morning before embarkation, daily dosing with food/milk, and seven-day post-return continuation accurately.
Explicitly documents taking the malaria pill with a cracker if a meal is missed.
Warning signs and glucose-check/email instructions are absent.
No documentation of pen color change, cost explanation, insurance appeal, or free replacement boxes.
Includes storage guidance to keep pens needle-side up in the cabin fridge.
Hypoglycemic episode, excursion meal skips, pen-mixing worries, and travel stress not captured.
Does not state patient age, diabetes diagnosis code, or other pertinent chart context.
Note includes only three of the many clinically relevant items; overall completeness poor.
Key elements omitted and one unrelated ketone-strip SNOMED code added; moderate penalty.
No fabricated dosages or major false statements; minor extraneous detail only.
